wifindus.eye

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • wifindus.EventObject<NodeEventListener>
      • wifindus.eye.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MySQLUpdateTarget

    public class Node
extends EventObject<NodeEventListener>
implements MySQLUpdateTarget
    A mesh node device forming part of the WFU client network route.
    Author:
    Mark 'marzer' Gillard

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(java.lang.String hash,
    NodeEventListener... listeners)
        Creates a new Node, representing a Node entry from the database.
        Parameters:
        hash - The randomly 8-character hash key of this Node.
        listeners - A variable-length list of event listeners that will watch this node's state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if hash is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if hash is not valid.

    • Method Detail

      • getHash

        public final java.lang.String getHash()
        Gets this Node's Hash.
        Returns:
        An 8-character String containing this Node's unique Hash ID.

      • getAddress

        public final java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
        Gets this Node's IP Address.
        Returns:
        An InetAddress object containing information about the last-known address this Node connected from.

      • getLocation

        public final Location getLocation()
        Gets this Node's Location.
        Returns:
        A Location object containing the last-known location information this Node reported.

      • getLastUpdate

        public final java.sql.Timestamp getLastUpdate()
        Gets this Node's last update timestamp.
        Returns:
        An sql.Timestamp object representing the date/time the last known update was received. Since Timestamp is a mutable structure, the returned object is a clone, and thus calling any mutators will have no effect on the Node's timestamp data.

      • getVoltage

        public final java.lang.Double getVoltage()
        Gets the voltage of the node's DC power source.
        Returns:
        A double value indicating the DC voltage of the node's power source as measured by an external sensor, or null (for no data).

      • mapEvents

        protected void mapEvents(java.lang.String event,
             NodeEventListener listener,
             java.lang.Object... data)
        Description copied from class: EventObject
        Maps event keys to recipient functions on listener objects.
        Specified by:
        mapEvents in class EventObject<NodeEventListener>
        Parameters:
        event - The key of the event to map. Will always be in lowercase, regardless of how it was called.
        listener - The listener object to fire the events on.
        data - Variable-length list of data passed from the initial call to EventObject.fireEvent(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).
